item.content:encoded: I am pretty sure gamble fish predates perfect poker.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Salty Dog pet: 1-11% chance of N1 entry return (get the ticket back after entering a tournament, I think). Unlocks from N1, possibly from entering a T3 or T4 tournament. Levels up from Salty Ticket Shreds - you get 1 from entering a T3 N1 tournament, and 3 from entering a T4.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Then again, Gamble Fish is a special bonus to those who bothered with perfect poker as soon as it came out. I ignored it myself, though. Too expensive for what I was saving for.

Also his level 100 bonus is "Max Ability: Second Chance at failed Quest Attempts"

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Nah, it's show as available for me, and I just have a lvl 100 Cave Puppy. It may just require that you unlock Perfect Poker, since I couldn't see it a couple days ago, but people were mentioning it in the PH chat.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: We have a new pet: Gamble Fish Lv0 (1-100% Added PH Ryo from Missions) and the level up item is called Sure Thing. Someone else will have to check the prerequisites since it seems they don't show up if you fulfil them, it is the last one though so probably the same or above the 300 pet levels.

item.title: Ninja Tortoise
item.content:encoded:
Ninja Tortoise is indeed a TMNT reference. Specifically, it refers to Mikey, a real life ninja turtle doll, and my favorite ninja. The item was originally added when a player named Sheikun (okay, it was me) wrote 11 a short note about Mikey and returned it with the third NYC scavenger hunt discovery.

And now you know, and knowing is half the battle!

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I believe Red Herring is a reference to Magikarp just by the splash attack description and the fact that Magikarp IS a red fish. It is a true Wizzardess that that is what a red herring is but many things in bvs have multiple references

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
The bonuses are linked to the level of that pet. Using the 1%-20% example, you start off at 1% at Level 1, and once you hit Level 5 (or is it 6? not sure) it goes up to 2%. Every 5 levels after that adds 1% until you hit 20%.

The same principle applies to the other variations such as the Honey Badger's 1%-10%; the percentage goes up 1% every 10 levels and so on.

item.title: Bonuses
item.content:encoded: The normal bonus, for example, of Cave Puppy, is 1%-20% Item Find. This percentage is in someway related to the Pet Level or is completely random?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
"As of this writing, the Pet Point awards are not listed as doubled during Main Event panels. They are being doubled, but do not list that in the rewards."

I am pretty sure the above is a bug in the BvS BillyCon Enhancer script and not an issue of BvS itself.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Uh, no. A red herring is a term used to describe a false clue (usually obvious to find) to lead people away from the truth. Hence why it gives no standard bonus and its level up item is an Obvious Clue.

In short, your post is a red herring. >_> *runs away from the bad joke*
